es.csic.iiia.nsm.net.norm
Class NormativeNetwork

java.lang.Object
  es.csic.iiia.nsm.net.norm.NSMNetwork<Norm>
      es.csic.iiia.nsm.net.norm.NormativeNetwork

public class NormativeNetwork
extends NSMNetwork<Norm>

A normative network is a directed graph whose nodes stand for norms and whose edges stand for relationships between norms. Additionally, the normative network contains the following information about the norms it contains:

  1. the state (whether active or inactive) of each norm in the normative network;
  2. the utility of each norm, which contains information about how the norm performs to avoid conflicts with respect to the system norm evaluation dimensions and goals; and
  3. the generalisation level of each norm in the network, which stands for the height of the norm in the generalisation graph

Author:
"Javier Morales (jmorales@iiia.csic.es)"
See Also:
Norm, Utility

getNotRepresentedNorms

public java.util.List<Norm> getNotRepresentedNorms()
Returns a List of all the norms that are not represented in the normative network. That is, those norms that are inactive in the normative network and all its ancestors are inactive as well

Returns:
a List of all the norms that are not represented in the normative network. That is, those norms that are inactive in the normative network and all its ancestors are inactive as well

getGeneralisationLevel

public int getGeneralisationLevel(Norm norm)
Returns the generalisation level of a norm in the network. The generalisation level indicates the position (i.e., height) of the norm in the network. As an example, while a "leaf" norm in the network has level 0, its immediate parent has level 1, and the parent of the parent has level 2

Parameters:
norm - the norm
Returns:
the generalisation level of the norm
